humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report provides the tumor size for the invasive ductal carcinoma as 3.0 cm and 0.8 cm, which are the two focal tumors. Since the largest tumor size is 3.0 cm, and it is larger than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm, the pathologic T stage is T2, based on the rules provided. The presence of ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS) or the percentage of the tumor occupied by in situ component does not affect the T stage for invasive ductal carcinoma, so the T stage remains T2.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The pathologic T stage for cancer is determined by the size of the tumor. In this report, the larger invasive ductal carcinoma has a diameter of 3 cm, which falls within the T2 category (tumor size 2.1-5 cm). Therefore, the T stage from this report is T2.
